definition: variant of 閒人|闲人[xian2 ren2]/idle person/idler/unconcerned person

sentences.english: The farmer built an electric fence around his field to put an end to trespassing .
sentences.chinese: 那农民在他的田地四周筑起一道电网，以防闲人侵入。

sentences.english: A sign on the office door said"Off limits to all unauthorized personnel".
sentences.chinese: 办公室门上贴有标志“闲人免进”。

sentences.english: William: I have no time to record history. Let those free people do that.
sentences.chinese: 我没时间记录历史，让那些闲人去做吧。

sentences.english: Obviously like something happened and she scratched you.
sentences.chinese: 很闲人就像有些事发生了，她挠了你。

sentences.english: Can reserve a loiterer as well.
There were only the passersby on the side watching the excitement and making comments.
sentences.chinese: 只有一帮闲人帮旁边看热闹指点江山。

sentences.english: We entered through a door marked "Private".
sentences.chinese: 我们穿过一扇写着“闲人免进”的门。

sentences.english: Source of water, no entry without permission.
Sensitive paper data should be kept in a locked, limited-access area.
sentences.chinese: 敏感的文件数据要锁起来，闲人免进。

sentences.english: Love is the business of the idle and the idleness of the busy.
sentences.chinese: 爱情是闲人的正经事，忙人的偷闲玩意。

definition: to hang on to and serve the rich and powerful by literary hack work etc
to snatch a moment of leisure/to take a break from work/also written 偷閒|偷闲[tou1 xian2]
to snatch a moment of leisure/to take a break from work
to live as a parasite/doing nothing to earn one's keep
to have nothing to do/to have time on one's hands
